title: Congratulating the Fort Hamilton High School Football Team and Coach Daniel Perez upon the occasion of winning the Public School Athletic League Championship
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  the  Fort  Hamilton High School
Football Team and Coach Daniel Perez upon the occasion  of  winning  the
Public School Athletic League Championship

WHEREAS,  Excellence  and  success in competitive sports can be achieved
only through strenuous practice, team play and team spirit, nurtured  by
dedicated coaching and strategic planning; and
  WHEREAS, Athletic competition enhances the moral and physical develop-
ment of the young people of this State, preparing them for the future by
instilling  in  them  the  value  of teamwork, encouraging a standard of
healthy living, imparting a desire for success and developing a sense of
fair play and competition; and
  WHEREAS, The Fort Hamilton High School Football Team of Brooklyn,  New
York, are the Public School Athletic League (PSAL) Champions; the Tigers
won  their  third  PSAL football city championship in six seasons with a
8-6 victory over Lincoln High School; this was  the  first  high  school
football  game  to take place at Yankee Stadium in the Bronx, and it was
the Tigers first title since winning consecutively in 2005 and 2006; and
  WHEREAS, The athletic talent displayed by this team is  due  in  great
part  to  the efforts of Coach Daniel Perez, a skilled and inspirational
tutor, respected for his ability to develop potential  into  excellence;
and
  WHEREAS,  The  team's  overall  record  is  outstanding,  and the team
members were loyally and enthusiastically  supported  by  family,  fans,
friends and the community at large; and
  WHEREAS, The hallmarks of the Fort Hamilton High School Football Team,
from  the  opening  game of the season to participation in the champion-
ship, were a brotherhood of athletic ability, of good sportsmanship,  of
honor  and  of  scholarship,  demonstrating  that these team players are
second to none; and
  WHEREAS, Athletically and academically, the team members  have  proven
themselves to be an unbeatable combination of talents, reflecting favor-
ably on their school; and
  WHEREAS,  Coach Daniel Perez has done a superb job in guiding, molding
and inspiring the team members toward their goals; and
  WHEREAS, Sports competition instills the values of teamwork, pride and
accomplishment, and Coach Daniel Perez and  these  outstanding  athletes
have  clearly made a contribution to the spirit of excellence which is a
tradition of their school; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
congratulate  the  Fort Hamilton High School Football Team; its members:
Travon Reid Segure, Wesley Sumpter, Lamont  Williams,  Brandon  Reddish,
Shaquille  Russell,  Stephan  Williamsom,  Uhuru  Abdul  Saleem, Rasheem
Stroud, Peter Zappala, Marvin Van Cooten, Marvin Centeno,  Tallal  Sala-
meh,  Dylan  Campili,  Thaddeus  Stroud,  Oluwatoba  Akinleye,  Mohammed
Hamdan, Shaidel Lowman, Stefon Hayles, Jakim Williamson,  James  Howell,
Tyler  Price,  Omar Aman, Tyrone Raymond, Robert Thomas, Khalif Tulloch,
Armani Garrick, Nicholas Rey, Kimani  Robinson,  Mensur  Ibric,  Michael
Basso,  John  Tedesco, Mathew Lloyd, Kevon Foster, Ivan Foy, Devon Whar-
ton, Najee Daniels, Isaiah Tyler, and Remi  Yusuf;  and  Coaches  Daniel
Perez,  Rodney Knight, Dominick Spinelli, Reginald Wilson, Carl Johnson,
Jonathan Skelly, and Whitfield Morris,  as  well  as  Athletic  Director
Susan Russo and Principal Jo Ann Chester on their outstanding season and
overall team record; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  the  members of the Fort Hamilton High School Football Team
and to the aforementioned coaches and administrative staff.
